body:
sorry ignore the comment about RequestContextCurrentTraceContext.

ES credentials thread only looks at file. If it made a RPC call to get credentials using armeria client, it would create a trace context break. So no need to worry about that as we only look at file which should not trigger any trace as we don't auto-instrument anything in this part.
protip: a single line in the description or commit "fixes #1646" would magically close it
oh wow github is smarter than I thought about auto closing!
I think this should be on brave's gh-pages, right? zipkin.io/brave will resolve to that
Thanks @hanahmily , looking forward to your next PR ;-)
Can you confirm the zipkin version you're using, and what is the storage backend ?
our resident docker expert @llinder may have an idea about this ?

As can be seen in the [Kafka Collector](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-collector/kafka/src/main/java/zipkin2/collector/kafka), there is no manual partition assignment happening. Therefor a span reporter using multiple partitions is not an issue, in fact it's the standard Kafka Consumer working.
We can safely consider async span representation done (and eventually dusted) since Zipkin v2.

Not sure how much of a manual chore doing releases still is (apart from writing the release notes and kicking bintray / travis around), if so maybe [github actions](https://github.com/marketplace?type=actions) could be leveraged. But ultimately it's @adriancole to call this, as he's doing most releases.

@adriancole it's late, i don't have the energy to scrutinize 77 comments of this issue, but i have a hunch that this issue can be closed given v2 being out in the open for quite a while. Unless you object, i'll close it tomorrow.

Roger, time to close this one.

![roger-rabbit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/82499508-0e3f1600-9af2-11ea-8616-be8538d4839d.jpg)

See also https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/1219 , most of the documentation is present. We should just bundle it a bit in the top-level collector [README.md](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-collector)

> Can you confirm the zipkin version you're using, and what is the storage backend ?

not use the storage backend,it used in memory, the zipkin version is  latest.

@jorgheymans wonder if there are tags or otherwise we can use for things you've processed and are awaiting this or that. ex even if it is ok close in favor of another issue that once closed addresses this. 

just thinking how to reduce your burden which is in any case severely appreciated!

late or not. go for close. appreciate your usual scrutiny but agree this
one would be a day of effort to summarize as.. we should close it ;)

> Can you confirm the zipkin version you're using, and what is the storage backend ?

the excute.jar by mvn install source code ! . i dont konw the way of package is correct?

:musical_note: Another one bites the dust :musical_note: 

@jcchavezs and at your request here's the Mercury emoji ☿️
Building from source is not needed, follow the quick-start to get going https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin#quick-start and report back if you encounter any issues.

> encounter

I need change the  storage backend to support oracle , but i dont find related way,so i want change the source code .

> I need change the storage backend to support oracle , but i dont find related way,so i want change the source code .

it has been supported oracle?

Oracle is not a supported storage option, there is a mysql storage option but it's not recommended for (high volume) production usage. See https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-storage if you want to explore making your own storage backend.

Apart from that, cloning and following the instructions here https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin#running-the-server-from-source should give you a running server.

> e. See https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-storage if you want to explore making your own storage backend.

thanks for much

`CorrectForClockSkew` was ported to javascript for Zipkin classic here https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/commit/d950bd8dc6ab7cc26da85050b976eefb7789f549 . Any enhancements needed to detect invalid trace data in the view layer should be reported directly against Lens.
If branch releases become a frequent thing (and at least in this issue nobody thinks it will) tooling will emerge.

`git log --follow -p -- zipkin/src/main/java/zipkin/AsyncSpanConsumer.java` shows that the concept of `AsyncSpanConsumer` was reworked into `StorageComponent` (see https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/commit/0635ffbc848e7ed351055205f21918d7e3bcf860 ). 

From the storage components, only the Cassandra storage is lacking metrics, this is better tracked in https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/1769.

Closing for the same reason as https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/1499#issuecomment-631732359 . This is an issue thread about the design of zipkin v2 model, which has been released long since.

For the moment it's ok, no extra tags or so needed. I can keep track of
outstanding things without, as the list is getting smaller and smaller.
Thanks !
@jorgheymans notes we have a less useful stamp sized screenshot here which does not help deciding what needs to be done. @mstaalesen do you remember what this is about ?

Sorry for the lack of reply. We'd have to see if the latest versions of things (testcontainers, rabbitmq, travis) have magically fixed the problem or if more investigation is needed. It's not high priority though since we can use the travis service in the meantime.
Ok so it's in the same category as this then, https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/2781 . Probably still worth a look then, reopening.
thanks for keeping the project eyes focused @jorgheymans !
yaml somewhat from here https://github.com/openzipkin-attic/zipkin-azure/blob/master/appveyor.yml
hmm I like the idea of that better @anuraaga as I don't have to create a fake appveyor account for the org, share password etc..
ok PTAL! https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/actions/runs/115447278
added hash keys, where only npm is conditional on OS as maven downloads should be well.. java write once run everywhere right?

I'm abandoning this as MutableSpan in brave is possibly a better choice to use directly vs us copy similar types back and forth between here and brave. Since collectors can use Java 8, and different streaming engines have different transform functions.. possibly better to let experience accrue as localized plugins to projects like kafka-storage vs generalize at this point.
Thanks for the help @anuraaga and @chokoswitch

IS this really hard? Will it be added at some point ? 
thanks
@hanahmily you have time to give this a try?

I got https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/1870#issuecomment-470068636 working again, but it is a bit of a dependency mess. hoping we can leverage work of armeria here to avoid this and let people opt-in for bootstrap service registration https://github.com/line/armeria/pull/2701

could people here please mention what if anything you configure in eureka besides the service name and the eureka host address? With recent developments in Armeria, we may be able to do this out-of-box. I presume the only thing desired here is registering the zipkin http listener.

cc @minwoox
The reason I'm asking is that I'm told if we internally use `EurekaUpdatingListenerBuilder`, we can register on startup, even in zipkin-slim, with no dependencies at all.

> A minor update to the script would register zipkin under the service id zipkin-server instead of unknown. For this we need to add -Dspring.application.name=zipkin-server when launching zipkin.jar

For this we can do something like in Armeria:
```java
ServerBuilder sb = ...;
sb.serverListener(EurekaUpdatingListener.builder(eurekaUri)
                                        .instanceId("zipkin-server")
                                        .build());
```
Thanks @adriancole
dupe of #3072 I think. thanks for the hint.. if you are up to raising a PR with the fix and unit test, would be grand!

I think I am having the same issue (or something similar to #2989?)

```
    -Djava.security.auth.login.config="jaas.config" \
    -jar zipkin-2.19.2.jar
```

thanks for the looks!
Closing, as the default query end time no longer misses newest traces. There are other issues with the component handling custom lookback, but that is / will be tracked in separate issues.

Actually thats not happening on master branch, this error happens on :latest tag of openzipkin/zipkin image. 

Master branch and :master tag does no having this issue 🎉

@ffahri thanks for the note.. not sure why the webhook didn't take, but I pushed our rebuild docker tag ( git push origin docker-2.21.3) so should ideally work in the next hour https://hub.docker.com/repository/registry-1.docker.io/openzipkin/zipkin/builds/47b1682b-90da-429c-bfd6-7769ee6dd470
hi this is a duplicate of #2620. you can watch that issue. we were waiting for more people to be interested
@literatureandyou when you asked were you interested in a collector or to trace rocketmq?
This issue seems to have reached a conclusion to not do this. @drolando feel free to share how you went about tackling this if you think it's still relevant.

I'm closing this mainly because it is very old and we would have heard from other people if it was a priority. Increasingly we are encouraging "local root" tags which allow more tags coupled but without inflating spans so much. we can revisit if the topic comes up but right now let's close.
@anuraaga great tip on the comment in empty catch.. wish I thought of it, but glad you did :)

LGTM

I think we had the same reaction but will admit to being better at getting in the shoes of the oppressor ;)
awesome!

I don't know Whats mean about "one result""{0} results"?
 Can you describe it in detail?
 Where did this come from? I haven't seen this field

I don't know Whats mean about "one result""{0} results"?
Can you describe it in detail?
Where did this come from? I haven't seen this field

@uckyk when you click search on the traces screen

"One result" means one trace returned matching the search parameters
"{0} results" means more than one trace matched the search parameters

the text is new for chinese as never was translated

"One result": "一条"
"{0} results": "多条"

got  it . here it is

"One Result" : "1条结果"
"{0} Results"："{0} 条结果"

> got it . here it is
> 
> "One Result" : "1条结果"
> "{0} Results"："{0} 条结果"

seems better.

hmm there's no more "Try Lens UI" button as lens is default. Can you validate you are running a recent version of zipkin?

I run in windows os , so I use  zipkin-server-2.12.9-exec.jar ,from page 
 [ https://dl.bintray.com/openzipkin/maven/io/zipkin/java/zipkin-server](https://dl.bintray.com/openzipkin/maven/io/zipkin/java/zipkin-server/) , UI Search printscreen:
![z1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7985398/83854970-031ef380-a74a-11ea-9a4f-3efdfb6e097d.png)
![z2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7985398/83854978-05814d80-a74a-11ea-9e0d-e822f64c4500.png)

I see. As a project we don't accept support requests on old versions as we can't re-release old versions anyway. If you update to latest you'll notice there's no question on this issue as lens is default. Do you mind giving a try?
ok

Thanks for reporting, any chance you can attach such trace and maybe a screenshot / animated gif showing the issue ? You can download the trace through the UI. Make sure to remove any sensitive data (easily done using search/replace from a text editor, as values are often repeated).

This does not sound unreasonable to me. Rule of three may apply though. 

Curious: which storage backend do you use and which search criteria are troublesome for your site ?
Not wanting to play the stale bot here, but i'm closing this as it has not been reported or commented on since pretty much 4 years ago. Feel free to reopen if you feel strongly about this still.
Is generalizing the Lazy behaviour still going to happen or are we going to be lazy about it and let it be ? Lazy consensus applies, if i don't hear back in a couple of weeks i'm closing this.

thanks for your quick response. attached are screenshots that show missing bubbles (there are 3 circles visible but you can see atleast 4 listed in the show all annos view). i am not entirely sure what aspects of the data i can share yet, ideally this should be easy repro? i could see the DOM elements for each circle listing all the annos as well.[](url)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66497287/84825377-34af7e80-afd6-11ea-984f-97d5e7000d4f.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66497287/84825436-455ff480-afd6-11ea-995a-0d5c9bb7a9d1.png)
We have a custom key value store and due to some scale constraints dont have some of these indices setup yet.

Thanks for the screenshot. For sure it's easy repro but someone willing to
fix this bug would be happy to have at least one test case readily
available to work with. It just reduces the needed energy and threshold
when wanting to spend time on fixing this (hence increasing the odds of it
getting looked at).

Makes sense.  ls there a standard test trace json i can use to create a repro ?

@mrajah-twttr are the v1 lookup fields "serviceName" and "spanName" still ok? or is it only "serviceName" that you have at the moment.

PS there is a way to disable the search screen at the moment, just not to pare down the criteria (only add.. ex the site-specific tags features allows more not less choices)

Some other points:

The tags search is implemented the same as the old annotationQuery "foo=bar and baz", even if it looks different on the new UI. Do you not have this feature at all?

remoteServiceName is dependent on serviceName and is auto-populated.. It might be possible to control the visibility of this when the result is empty (which could have the same effect and still honor browser cache controls)

I don't think we need to make more library coupling by adding a super-type for lazy here. 

Consider brave has recently removed the zipkin dep, if anything this could probably be punted to the libraries themselves, or left as-is.

1. Yes, We dont have anno search index currently.
2. serviceName is fine, spanName doesnt seem to work (when the page loads i can see a call to zipkin/api/v2/services made nothing for span). may be its never meant to be the top level criteria?
3. When i choose serviceName i can see the call being made to "zipkin/api/v2/remoteServices?serviceName=" and "zipkin/api/v2/spans?serviceName=" the former doesn't exist and latter [works].
Is there any doc on the APIs the UI calls and the expected response structures?

spanName should be conditional on serviceName.. it won't work top-level
remoteServices was a recent index (twitter won't have it) but this is something I think we can special case 404 response (which I thought we did at some point!)
empty string should never be sent.. that seems a bug

https://zipkin.io/zipkin-api/#/default is the api
I use in-mem server (default jar file) plus the instructions in the zipkin-lens folder to do dev. You can also point the node app to your real backend.

this tip about the "debugger" keyword can help if you end up using the 'npm start' approach https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-js#debugging
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-lens/testdata but i think easier would be to just anonymize an existing trace, whatever works for you though.

"empty string should never be sent.. that seems a bug" i dont have this issue, i truncated the URL i gave :)  apologies for the confusion. it does send the right name..

If service name selection is required may be we should hide options like spanName, minDuration, maxDuration until a serviceName is chosen? 

(Still need a way to disable remoteService and tags)

Actually https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-lens/testdata/netflix.json shows this error. you can look at the 2nd span for service EVCACHE_G it has 3 annos but only 1 circle is shown since they all share same timestamp.

so looks like the results view has 1 span it thinks is unknown

![Screenshot 2020-06-18 at 4 18 35 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64215/84996094-6748ab00-b17f-11ea-9f33-9a415f154661.png)

the trace view identifies the root span's service (routing), but yeah the service labels don't show

![Screenshot 2020-06-18 at 4 18 42 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64215/84996140-762f5d80-b17f-11ea-8616-211c5a6aacb7.png)

also there's no error in the console

the problem specifically is this span, which is marked shared but is missing the client span:

```json
    "traceId": "e16be24f11073022",
    "parentId": "71f8077e2923a571",
    "id": "41b68e37ddbdb23e",
    "kind": "SERVER",
    "name": "get biz .__fallback__ ",
```
taking the "shared" flag off that span allows rendering the service name list in the details view. So, we are tolerant to the bad data, but not enough..
